intro: Boechera shockleyi, commonly known as the Shockley's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Boechera shockleyi is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
